* @param dateString  The date string representing the deadline.
* @param isDone      The completion status of the task.

* The Event class represents a task that spans a specific time range.
* It is a subclass of the Task class.

* @param start       The start time of the event.

* The Lia class represents the main class for the Lia task manger.
* It orchestrates the interaction between the user interface, task storage, and command parser.
* Constructs a Lia object, initializing the user interface, storage, task list, and parser.
* It attempts to load tasks from storage and handles any loading exceptions.
* Runs the Lia application, displaying the welcome message and processing user commands until "exit" is entered.
* The LiaException class is a custom exception class for handling exceptions specific to the Lia application.
* Constructs a LiaException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The detail message (which is saved for later retrieval by the getMessage() method).
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user commands and delegating actions accordingly.
* It interacts with the user interface, task list, and handles parsing and execution of commands.
* Constructs a Parser object with the specified user interface and task list.
* @param tasks The task list to be managed by the parser.
* Parses the user command and performs the corresponding action.
* @param input The user command to be parsed.
System.out.println("Your task list is currently empty.");

throw new LiaException("lia.Task description cannot be empty.");

* The Storage class handles the loading and saving of tasks from/to a file.
* It interacts with the TaskList and various task-related classes for file I/O operations.
private static final Path FILE_PATH = Paths.get(PROJECT_FOLDER, FOLDER_NAME, FILE_NAME);

* The Task class represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* It serves as the base class for more specific task types like Todo, Deadline, and Event.

* Displays a welcome message when Lia is started.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");

* @param tasks The updated list of tasks.
